text:
Hey <@U07GH693CF5>, bit of a broad question but here is possible answer, the same way you access HubSpot properties. Here is a basic code for reading contact with my test_property (remember to use internal names, visible in the edit property settings).

`import HubSpot
from pprint import pprint
from HubSpot.crm.contacts import ApiException`

`client = HubSpot.Client.create(access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN")`

`try:
    api_response = client.crm.contacts.basic_api.get_by_id(contact_id="contactId", properties=["test_property"], archived=False)
    pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
    print("Exception when calling basic_api->get_by_id: %s\n" % e)`
there was a HubSpot cli update
I just reran the job in Github and it seems to have succeeded for me this time
